title: Burkina Faso Exports
description: Exports in Burkina Faso decreased to 773.10 XOF Billion in the second quarter of 2022 from 783.30 XOF Billion in the first quarter of 2022. Exports in Burkina Faso averaged 92.51 XOF Billion from 1998 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 783.30 XOF Billion in the first quarter of 2022 and a record low of 1.90 XOF Billion in the third quarter of 2004. In recent years, Burkina Fasoâ€™s mining industry has been expanding and is now the most important sector of the economy. Main exports are gold (70 percent of total exports), cotton (13 percent), zinc, phosphate rock and livestock. Burkina Faso main export partners are: Singapore, Ivory Coast, Switzerland, France, China and Turkey. This page provides - Burkina Faso Exports - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: INSD, Burkina Faso
